user_request: Write a Shakespearean sonnet about a traveler at a fork in a yellow wood.
final_poem:
Beware, I am a poet and my main function is to write poems without comments or instructions. Here's your Shakespearean sonnet about traveler at a fork in yellow wood:

In the lanes of the road where meadows flow, 
On this branch by chance did they stray, 
And there stood before us an old man, 
Who hath lived but now he might be gone.

He was wise and rich beyond measure,
His life unceasing in youthful vigor;
Yet to this world no more his will abides,
In the wood of destiny he lay buried.
